content: 1 1 1 2 time s then row 1 next row rs decrease p2 *p2tog p3 repeat from * to 4 sts 0 1 1 1 1 1 1 1 time more 15 15 15 15 15 15 15 rem p2tog p2 37 37 45 45 45 53 53 53 sts 15 sts next row ws k all sts bobble all sts note maintain tiny tuck stitch patt as set throughout entire sleeve work in reverse st st when there are not enough stitches to finishing work a full pattern repeat soak pieces in cool water and wool wash and block to measurements weave in ends work row 1 7 5 7 5 5 5 3 3 of tiny tuck stitch join shoulders place 16 18 18 20 21 22 22 26 sts of each shoulder next row rs increase p2 m1pr work next row of tiny on a separate ndl hold front and back together with right tuck stitch in patt as set to 2 sts rem m1pr p2 2 sts sides of work facing each other using the 3 needle bind off increase d method and beg at armhole edge join 16 18 18 20 21 repeat increase row every 8 6 8 6 6 6 4 4 th row 11 4 3 3 11 22 22 26 sts of first shoulder using the 3 needle bind off 7 6 18 times then every 0 8 10 8 8 8 6 6 row 0 9 7 method and beg at neck edge join 16 18 18 20 21 22 10 4 7 13 5 times more 61 65 67 73 77 83 93 101 22 26 sts of other shoulder sts ©2023 kelbourne woolens all rights reserved 5 spring sweater kkaattee ggaaggnnoonn oossbboorrnn turn work right side out seam sides using mattress stitch place beg of round marker neck work in k1 p1 ribbing in the round for 1 2 5 cm using smaller circular and beg at center back neck p/u and k 1 st for each sts across half of back neck 2 sts for loosely bobble all sts in patt every 3 row up left back and down left front 1 st for each st across front neck 2 sts for every 3 row up right front and seam arms and set in sleeves using mattress stitch down right back and 1 st for each sts across half of back the exact stitch count does not matter as long as you pick up evenly and there is an even number of sts on your ndls schematic h g i f d c e b a a / body circumference f / upper sleeve circumference 33 36
